titleStmt.title: Scapes in printing▪ at which if the Reader stagger, let him reade thus.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Scapes in printing▪ at which if the Reader stagger, let him reade thus.

monogr.title: A treatise of Melchisedek : prouing him to be Sem, the father of all the sonnes of Heber, the fyrst king, and all kinges glory: by the generall consent of his owne sonnes, by the continuall iudgement of ages, and by plentifull argumentes of scripture
monogr.author: Broughton, Hugh

div.head: Scapes in printing▪ at which if the Reader stagger, let him reade thus.
div.p: sickerly for sickerles, A ii. line 33. Sixtus for Pius at A 4. line 12. for 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for from from Vr from Vr. blunter beastes read brestes. For moueth vs to fayth, meeteth vs by fayth. F. b. i. the fourth side, line 13. for Ramban read Rambam H i. b. in the margent. reade Psal. 48. for 180. D ii. a. line 14. F iii. b. reade that in a Politicall. Gen. 11. not. 12. F. iii. the thirde page, lyne. 33.
